snippet: New York has some of the strongest anti-usury laws in the nation, but that could change if a deeply flawed bill pending in the Legislature goes forward.
abstract: Editorial opposes bill pending in the New York State Legislature that would allow check-cashing businesses to charge higher interest rates and to enter the lending business; warns bill will expose many poor borrowers to a form of financial exploitation.
lead_paragraph: New York has some of the strongest anti-usury laws in the nation, but that could change if a deeply flawed bill pending in the Legislature goes forward.
